page.title: 06HALLATON SCHOOLING
page.content: There is a pre-school Playgroup at Belton-in-Rutland, which some village children attend - others go to Uppingham. Hallaton is still fortunate to have its own Church of England primary school, taking children aged from 4 to 11. At present there are 20 children on the roll, with a staff of three teachers. Not all the 4 to 11 year olds go to the village school - over half are educated out of the state system at schools such as Nevill Holt, Oakham and Uppingham. This is more a reflexion of the relative affluence of some Hallaton parents than a comment on the school itself, but the low numbers at the school do make its future uncertain. After age 11, children then go to schools at Kibworth and Market Harborough, taken by school bus.
